body: Gehry on Gehry Town Hall, 123 West 43rd Street; (212) 753-1722. The architect Frank Gehry will speak about his work on Tuesday at 6:30 p.m. to mark the publication of his book ''Gehry Talks: Architecture and Process'' (Rizzoli, 1999). The event is being sponsored by the Architectural League of New York. Tickets, available at Town Hall, $10.
title: CALENDAR; Lectures, Exhibitions, Sales and a Walking Tour

body: ATTRACTIONS Museums and Sites ABIGAIL ADAMS SMITH MUSEUM, 421 East 61st Street, Manhattan. The structure, built in 1799 as the carriage house for the estate of Abigail Adams and Col. William Smith, was also the Mount Vernon Hotel from 1826 to 1833. The current exhibition, ''Smith's Folly: 200 Years of History, 60 Years of Preservation,'' includes a
title: SPARE TIMES

body: Sometimes, the walls can talk. On the west wall of an old factory building on Plymouth Street, in a cobblestoned corner of old Brooklyn waterfront known as Dumbo, someone has spray-painted this observation in red: ''Dumbo=Soho '98.'' Just below is this exhortation in black: ''Revolt.'' With or without imminent revolt, this tiny enclave of old iron
title: A Neighborhood Identity Crisis; Transformation Brings Anxiety in Brooklyn's Dumbo

body: East River Waterfront Municipal Art Society; (212) 935-3960. The Municipal Art Society and the Van Alen Institute will offer three walking tours in conjunction with the institute's study of the East River waterfront, a two-year project involving exhibitions and an architectural competition. The first tour, on June 6, will feature sites in Hunters

title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: BROOKLYN UP CLOSE; Greenpoint to Sheepshead Bay: When the Boards Meet

body: To the Editor: In a world that is rapidly getting more homogenized and smaller each day, keeping our ethic customs is important but very hard (''Blini and Borscht in English,'' May 2). I see no reason for civic and business leaders to push any New York City neighborhood to give up its identity, its ethnic appeal in the name of business and
title: Signs in Russian Give Other-Worldly Feeling
